instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera Fault
threads.message:
Hey guys, got a strange one here.

Webcam works fine until a reboot and then shows that there is no camera connected.

When the camera stops working we still have 5v on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL>

We’ve tested this logic board with a known good screen and same fault. Tested the screen with another logic board and it works fine so we know it’s not a screen based issue.

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera Fault
threads.message: Also just to add that we’ve checked for the common flexgate issue on the camera flex and it looks fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera Fault
threads.message:
It happened after normal reboot, or computer rebooted by itself?

Test with USB macOS.
